disobedience.question: Was I disobedient to my parents?
disobedience.description: As per the fourth commandment, it's a child's duty to respond to parental love, wisdom, and respect with obedience.

disobedience.question: Did you reject the unity of the Church when struggling to understand or relate to others within it due to their imperfections?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Have I rejected the unity of the Catholic Church when frustrated by disagreements or misunderstandings within the community?
disobedience.description: Rejecting Church unity due to frustration with individuals is sinful because it confuses the Church's divine nature and eternal truths with the human imperfections of its members, while also violating Christ's prayer "that they may all be one."

disobedience.question: Did I condone a funeral where human remains were not buried, thus disrespecting the dignity of the deceased?
disobedience.description: Failing to advocate for proper burial of human remains is considered sinful as the Church teaches that the body is sacred and deserves reverent burial, with scattering or keeping remains being contrary to the dignity of the human body and resurrection belief.

disobedience.question: Did I ridicule the Church?
disobedience.description: Mocking the church shows contempt for Christ's established institution on earth, disrespects the Body of Christ, and undermines the Church's divine authority as guided by the Holy Spirit.

condoning.question: Did I condone a funeral where a deceased person's remains were scattered rather than reverently buried?

condoning.question: Did you remain silent about Church teachings, allowing social discomfort to influence your response?

adultery.question: Did I forgo a valid Catholic marriage through my actions?

gluttony.question: Did you overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, possibly neglecting your duties or responsibilities to others?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, potentially damaging my overall well-being and relationship with God?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I prioritized excessive and wasteful gambling over my financial obligations or family needs, recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to me?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I been excessively reckless in my financial dealings, putting the needs of others at risk due to poor prioritization?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing private concerns or troubles
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing private concerns or troubles, even if true, for my own enjoyment or to impress others?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in sharing unseemly details about acquaintances even if what I shared
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing unseemly details about acquaintances even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

impiety.question: Did I deliberately work on Sunday, choosing to engage in labor when it could have been avoided?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeking understanding and reconciliation in my relationships
anger.question: Have I nursed anger or held onto feelings of rage rather than seeking understanding and reconciliation in my relationships?
anger.description: Uncontrolled anger corrupts our own heart, damages our relationship with both God and neighbor.
